title: Security When Traveling With Less Stress And More Time To Enjoy Good Things
text:
July 2, 2015 - Elkhart, Indiana -- When travelling, one of the things travelers worry about is not knowing whether they need to pay extra if they go overboard with their luggage weight - especially when they are on a tight budget. Travelers are sometimes forced to lose some things from their luggage to make it lighter and fit the allowable weight.
To continue its mission to make everyone happy, aGreatlife introduces Digital Luggage Scale and is giving away Luggage Tags for free. "It is built with confidence and elegance and comes with an ergonomic steel design that looks and feels smooth that can be carried with one hand or two comfortably It can weigh as much as 110 lb or 50 kg and is user friendly," according to Tony Christer, co-founder of aGreatLife brand.
"These luggage tags are very useful in making the luggage more recognizable on the luggage carrousel. The tags are made to be durable with adjustable straps securing quickly to baggage handler. It is made this way to protect a traveler's personal information," Tony said when he was asked about how helpful the tags can be to travelers.
Digital scale and luggage tag are new aGreatlife products. According to a customer, "It is a must-have for every traveler, especially those frequent fliers. It is well worth getting one to avoid the hassle of overweight bags and the uncertainty of not knowing how much extra they might be charged when they show up unprepared." With these two products travelers can enjoy the security for their luggage when traveling with less stress and more time to enjoy good things.
aGreatLife luggage scale and tag are available from Amazon.com.
